preibisch_fusion

Class Interval

  • java.lang.Object
    • preibisch_fusion.Interval

  • public class Interval
extends Object
    A range on the number line with a min() and max() point.
    Author:
    Mark Hiner hinerm at gmail.com

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Interval(int... points)
      Constructs a new Interval using the smallest and largest values in the provided points.
      Interval(Interval interval)
      Copying constructor

    • Constructor Detail

      • Interval

        public Interval(int... points)
        Constructs a new Interval using the smallest and largest values in the provided points.

      • Interval

        public Interval(Interval interval)
        Copying constructor

    • Method Detail

      • setMin

        public boolean setMin(int min)
        Update the start position of this interval. If after this setting, min > max, sets max = min.
        Returns:
        true if the max was also modified during this call

      • setMax

        public boolean setMax(int max)
        Update the end position of this interval. If after this setting, max < min, sets min = max.
        Returns:
        true if the min was also modified during this call

      • min

        public int min()
        Returns:
        Start position for this interval

      • max

        public int max()
        Returns:
        End position for this interval

      • contains

        public int contains(int point)
        Returns:
        -1 if this interval is completely to the left of the point. 1 if this interval is completely to the right of the point. 0 if the interval intersects (contains) the point.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Interval other)
        Determines if this interval has an intersection with another interval.

      • equalsInterval

        public boolean equalsInterval(Interval other)
        Check to see if another interval is the same as this interval.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
